eu.excitement.entailment.core.representation.parsetree

Class AbstractNode<T,S extends AbstractNode<T,S>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.excitement.entailment.core.representation.parsetree.AbstractNode<T,S>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The information type of the node.
    S - The type of the node itself (this insures that the children have the same type of their parent).
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BasicNode

    public abstract class AbstractNode<T,S extends AbstractNode<T,S>>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    [DELETEME_LATER: imported from BIUTEE 2.4.1 with no modification] Represents a node in a parse tree.

    Important notes:

    1. AbstractNode is not immutable.
    2. No class that inherits AbstractNode may implement equals() and hashCode() methods. Implementing those methods breaks the internal logic. The assumptions is that a node is unique, and not equal any other node, even though they may have the same contetns.
    3. The information inside the node (the generic parameter T) must be immutable!
    4. The information type (the generic parameter T) must implement Serializable
    Author:
    Asher Stern
    See Also:
    AbstractNodeUtils, TreeAndParentMap, Serialized Form
